overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a highly detailed approach to time-series forecasting with ambiguous data quality. It focuses on handling a long stretch of zeros in historical data, interpreted as actual values rather than missing data. The method involves identifying daily seasonality, leveraging the only complete daily pattern available, and applying a custom linear scaling technique to project future values while accounting for perceived operational recovery.
common_data_patterns: Partial recovery in final data points
key_insights: Critical assumption that zeros represent actual operational states (no load) rather than missing data
Use of a single full day's pattern (2016-12-04) as a baseline template
Application of time-dependent linear scaling factors to model recovery
Integration of domain context (transformer load behavior) in pattern interpretation
Explicit handling of data recency by weighting recent non-zero values higher
complexity_analysis: Highly detailed with multi-step analysis involving data diagnostics, pattern extraction, scaling strategy design, and temporal alignment considerations.
